title: India vs Australia 1st Test, live cricket score: India start favourites in Pune | cricket | Hindustan Times
text:
Desimartini India vs Australia 1st Test, live cricket score: India start favourites in Pune 
India vs Australia live cricket score: India are unbeaten in 19 Tests over a 18-month period. The last time Australia toured India in 2013, they were blanked 4-0 in as many matches and have lost their last nine Tests in Asia. Follow India vs Australia, Pune Test, live here. cricket Updated: Feb 23, 2017 08:38 IST Siddharth Vishwanathan Hindustan Times Virat Kohli-led India are on a 19-Test unbeaten run and would hope to maintain the momentum against Australia. (AFP) 
The Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune will make its Test debut on Thursday with the first Test between India vs Australia. In last 20 home Tests, going back to December 2012, India have won 17 and drawn three. In the past decade, Australia have played 10 Tests in India, losing eight and drawing the rest. Follow live cricket score of India vs Australia here. ( LIVE SCORECARD | WHERE TO SEE LIVE STREAMING ) 
08:38 hrs IST : A warm welcome to the first Test between India vs Australia from Pune. Virat Kohli will be aiming to continue India’s dominant run while Australia will be hoping to turn their poor record in India around. 
Australia, ranked second in the world, have lost their last nine Tests in Asia and opted to pack their squad with four specialist spin bowlers to bog down an Indian side unbeaten in their last 19 Tests. 
India skipper Virat Kohli said he was not surprised that the opposition were not leaning on their traditional strength of attacking with fast bowlers. 
“Coming to India, playing in summers. Wickets are meant to be dry and they are meant to turn,” Kohli said. “You will have a stronger spin bowling attack then getting six, seven fast bowlers. That is a pretty natural selection.” 
India have to be watchful against Mitchell Starc. And Kohli’s know a bit about the 27-year-old paceman who played IPL with him as part of Royal Challengers Bangalore side. 
Mitchell Starc was the leading wicket-taker (24) for the side on the turning pitches in Sri Lanka last year, a series in which Australia were blanked 3-0. 
“He has really taken his game to the next level and that’s why he is counted among the top bowlers in world cricket and deserves to be there because he has worked really hard and the results are evident.” tags
